content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Use the following graph to answer parts (a)-(e). Prices and costs are in dollars.

The graph above shows the demand (<math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>), marginal revenue (<math alttext="M R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>), marginal cost (<math alttext="M C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>), and average total cost (<math alttext="A T C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) curves for one of many profit-maximizing firms operating in the short run in an industry in which there are no barriers to entry. Each firm sells a similar but not identical product.

(a) Calculate the total revenue of producing <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> units. Show your work.

(b) For quantities between <math alttext="160" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>160</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="180" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>180</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> units, is the demand curve elastic, inelastic, or unit elastic? Explain.

(c) Assume that this firm is currently charging a price of <math alttext="$100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. In order to maximize its profit, should the firm increase its price, decrease its price, or keep its price the same? Explain.

(d) At a quantity of <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> units, does this firm have increasing marginal returns or diminishing marginal returns? Explain.

(e) Identify the firm’s allocatively efficient quantity, and explain how you determined it.
